content.description: just to the right of the bulge finishes a little higher than Diablo.  pretty short and fun.  There seemed to be great holds and it's a perfect line.  I tended to stay left of the bolts and thought I was on the another line the whole time.  Super fun with Great holds
content.protection: only 2 bolts and chains.  slightly, only slightly run out between the last bolt and chains, but it's easy climbing.
content.location: Third one from the left, chains about 3/4 of the way up.

content.description:
This route was bolted for the kids.  The bolts are barely 5 feet apart, I can have one bolt at my waist and reach the next.  Perfect for kids learning how to lead climb.

The crux is getting past the first bolt. Some use an undercling to get started, but there are some crimps on the right if you want some fun. After the 2nd bolt it's super easy climbing
content.location: the route on the far right, finish at the first chains.

climbs.name: Inzane Ham and Cheese (originally called "8 Seconds")
climbs.fa: Actually bolted by Mike Wiser and FA by Mike Wiser

content.description: This alternate start to "Diablo" was set by one bad A, mofo climber.  When others said it couldn't be done, he just laughed in their faces and did it anyway.  That's just the type of dirtbag climber he is.  He never takes "no" for an answer.  He sometimes takes "maybe" for an answer, but never "no".  Sharp rock and  some big reaches, but who cares? The holds are great.
content.protection: 2 bolts.  Chains at the top.  The second bolt and chains are shared with "Diablo"
content.location: This is the second route you encounter on the wall.  Start between Diablo and Unknown and head towards the cave after you clip the first bolt.

content.description: Fun steep climbing with a good rest, then some more steepness.  I thought the crux was after the second bolt.
content.protection: bolts and anchors.  There are higher anchors if you want to climb and extra 5 feet
content.location: This isn't at campsite 7.  It's across the road 100 feet and up the hill a little bit

content.description: up to the first bolt is barely 5.7 climbing.  Find an awesome pocket to clip the 2nd bolt.  Prepare some fancy footwork to traverse the arete.  after that it's smooth sailing.
content.protection: three bolts and chains.  finishes at Unknown .10C
content.location:
the fourth route from the left. It starts next to a tree and goes underneath the large dihedral.  The second bolt is on the dihedral.  From there, traverse left and finish on the chains of

Unknown .10C

.

content.description:
scramble up and use the huge bat cave to reach your first and last bolt before the chains.  A couple of sequencial reachy moves gets you to a rat hole and you're at the chains. very short with a kneebar and some fun.

If the kids are around, you can clip the chains and let you kids climb up the left side and swing back and forth.
content.location: The first route you come to. it's just to the right of the big cave.

content.description: Climb Mac and continue another 10 feet to the chains.  After the chains to Mac, there's an awesome jug to clip the next bolt.  After that there are some reachy moves to get you up and over the bulge.  I thought this finish to Mac made the climb worthwhile.  Some fun moves with a little bit of dirt on it.
content.location: Right most route but finishes past the first set of chains.
